EXTERNAL: April 15, 2006

Who: Eggster
When: Saturday, April 15, 2006, 11:30am-12:00pm
Where: Lawn outside of VLSB
Audience: Children
Contact:
Nancy Yang
Eggster Event Committee Co-Chair
nyang@berkeley.edu
(510) 804-6124

Description:
On Saturday, April 15, 2006, Eggster will be holding its 12th annual Eggster Hunt and Learning
Festival on the UC Berkeley campus from 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. The Eggster Hunt and Learning Festival
is a completely student run, non-profit event, which seeks to unite children and families in the
surrounding communities of the Bay Area for a fantastic day of educational experiences and
cultural festivities through interactive learning booths, live performances, and egg hunts. Last
year, we attracted over 3,000 children and families from the Bay Area. We are hoping that your
group will be able to participate at some point during the day at the "Eggster Theater," which in
the past has included performances by Dance Junta, UC Martial Arts, and yourselves, among others.
If you are interested in performing at this year's event, we ask that you confirm your group by
emailing a response or by calling (see the number below) to reserve a 30 minute time slot. If your
group is not interested or cannot make the date, please take a minute to email me back with your
group name and a "no" in the subject line. If your group would like to participate, please email
me back by January 15, 2006. I will be sending an email with more details once I receive
confirmations. Thank you for your time.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi everyone!

Thank you so much for agreeing to perform at Eggster's Egghunt and Learning Festival this year! Again, it will be held on the VLSB lawn on Saturday, April 15th from 10 am-3 pm.
Please let us know if you will be available to perform at the times assigned to your respective groups below:

10:30-11 Satrang
11:30-12 Theatre Rice
12-12:30 Decadence
12:30-1 The Movement
1-1:30 Cal Jazz Choir
1:30-2 Cal Band

Please arrive half an hour before your performance time to allow sufficent time for your group to assemble and prepare before you perform at our "Eggster Theater" (it's the area in front of the stairway on the north side of VLSB, facing the lawn). You can also come by earlier to watch other performances by other student groups or watch the kiddies and their families visit our learning booths or watch the kids scramble for eggs in the egghunts. Just be ready to go on stage before your scheduled time. If you have music you will need for your performance, we'll have speakers and a cd player ready for you.

Ricers Signed Up:
